09Dec

7 Challenges ERP Helps Electronics Manufacturers Overcome

  • ERP Selection
  • Tags: Blogs

The electronics industry changes at a fast pace with constant innovations. Electronics are used in consumers everyday lives, both at work and at home. Electronics manufacturers have many revenue opportunities, but also many challenges to overcome to be competitive.

Electronics manufacturers must adapt to many emerging trends. They need to be nimble and keep their operations optimized. Lets review the most common challenges facing electronics manufacturers and how ERP provides technology to manage them.

1. Changes in Consumer Demand

When there is a downward trend in the economy, sales slow due to less consumer spending power. But even in a downturn, the demand for electronic items can increase. Demand constantly fluctuates, and it can be very challenging to align inventory with production needs. Being able to predict demand is critical.

Electronics manufacturing ERP software helps electronics manufacturers accurately forecast demand. Customer Resource Management (CRM) identifies what marketing has planned that could affect product sales and it offers useful data on historical sales trends. Inventory management in ERP tracks stock trends and provides real-time information on available stock. ERP business intelligence uses this and other data to forecast customer demand. Its advanced planning and scheduling uses information regarding available resources and machine capacity to optimize production, getting you ready to handle increased demand.

2. Short Product Life Cycles

High-tech electronic devices change rapidly as a result of innovations and product updates, so electronics manufacturers need to be lean and efficient. ERP software provides the tools to keep costs low and productivity optimized. Electronics manufacturers require effective inventory control so products can be manufactured as needed and shipped on time. They also need communication between sales, manufacturing, and engineering to ensure accurate product quantities and quality for successful product launches. Manufacturing ERPs quality management ensures industry, government, and internal requirements are met for electronics manufacturers.

3. Intricate Supply Chain

Many issues have occurred as a result of the pandemic, including supply shortages, changes in the international business landscape, and transportation issues. Many electronics manufacturers need items that are in high demand and in short supply. They often outsource parts of their products. Managing supply chain complexities is very challenging.

Manufacturing ERP software offers supply chain management that lets electronics manufacturers easily share data with vendors to let them see when orders need to be fulfilled so they can do it automatically. It also tracks vendor performance so electronics companies can proactively make changes if a vendor cant meet expectations. Supply chain management takes data from other ERP modules to understand what is needed and when. It uses algorithms and consumption analysis to forecast supply needs. Supply chain management helps electronics manufacturers be more agile by increasing efficiency, visibility, and productivity.

4. Tighter Operating Margins

The electronics manufacturing industry is highly competitive, requiring companies to work smarter. They have to keep costs low, productivity high, and continually find ways to improve. ERP software automates and connects the entire business to reduce errors, optimize processes, and keep the business running at peak performance. With its real-time data and business intelligence, it allows electronics manufacturers to closely scrutinize business performance and costs. It provides accurate job costing to eliminate guesswork when pricing products.

5. Raw Materials Unavailable

Since the pandemic, electronics manufacturers have been faced with raw material shortages. Manufacturing ERP helps electronics manufacturers keep tighter control of their operations and better plan for raw materials needed. Inventory management, supply chain control, procurement, production, and sales integration in ERP help electronics manufacturers forecast demand to secure the raw materials needed. ERP software lets electronics manufacturers easily collaborate with vendors to ensure that needed resources are on hand for production.

6. Service and Warranty Management

Many electronics manufacturers have products that have warranties and service agreements. Its important to ensure a high-quality product to keep the use of these services low and to keep customer satisfaction high. Manufacturing ERP uses quality management to track product components, which helps identify them quickly if any issues arise.

ERP service management handles all service contracts and warranty information. When a service rep is at a customers site, they can quickly look up the customers service contract, product warranty, or other customer data using a mobile app. They have access to customer addresses and can see notes about previous customer interactions. The service management module also tracks service staff performance and serial number genealogy. Manufacturing ERP optimizes service and warranty management for improved customer satisfaction.

7. Sustainability

There is more focus today on how companies operate and take care of their waste. Consumers like to buy from companies that engage in environmentally-friendly practices, and government agencies are more concerned than ever about proper product disposal and how it impacts the environment. Electronics manufacturers need to keep these things in mind as they design their products.

Manufacturing ERP helps the electronics industry be more sustainable by supporting lean manufacturing, which cuts costs and optimizes efficiency in the following ways:

  • Finding quality issues quickly
  • Avoiding overproduction and waste
  • Eliminating production delays
  • Providing streamlined workflow
  • Keeping inventory at optimal levels
  • Ensuring resources are fully utilized

Wrap Up

Electronics manufacturers are faced with significant challenges. ERP software for electronics manufacturing provides functionality to help them be more productive, cost-efficient, and streamlined, and to have the business insight needed to overcome most challenges. Using a modern ERP solution provides the tools electronics manufacturers need to be profitable and competitive in a volatile industry.

About OptiProERP

OptiProERP is a leading global provider of industry-specific ERP solutions for manufacturers and distributors. Backed by deep industry expertise and driven by a commitment to customer service, OptiProERP delivers best-in-class, end-to-end industry solutions built on the market-leading platform for small and midsize enterprises, SAP Business One.

OptiProERP, as part of eWorkplace Manufacturing, is SAPs strategic industry partner for manufacturing and distribution and its first OEM partner as part of SAPs global PartnerEdge Program.
